newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-ROBSON TO STEP DOWN AS BARCELONA COACH.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ROBSON TO STEP DOWN AS BARCELONA COACH.

text.p: Bobby Robson has been told he will not continue as Barcelona first team coach next season although he is expected to stay at the club.
"They told me 10 days ago," said Robson, in remarks published in the Spanish sport daily 'Marca' on Thursday.
The former England manager, who is expected to stay on at the club in a different capacity, said he would not discuss his future any further until after Saturday's Spanish Cup final.

"I know it's going to be my last game on the bench of the first team, and it is very important for me to say goodbye with a win," said Robson, in an interview with 'El Mundo Deportivo', also published on Thursday.
Robson joined Barcelona in the close season from Oporto in a move that was rushed through after the sacking of Johan Cruyff.
But Robson struggled to escape from the shadow of Cruyff, who had become the club's most successful coach ever in his eight years at Barcelona.

Despite winning the European Cup Winners' Cup, the Spanish Super Cup and a place in the Cup final, fans have found it difficult to forgive Robson for finishing second in the league to arch-rivals Real Madrid.
He has also been blamed for using unsophisticated tactics with one of Europe's most talented squads.
Ajax coach Louis van Gaal is the man most commentators feel will take over on the bench at the Camp Nou stadium.
